ygData.subject: RE: From EQCasters (and added to the FAQ)
ygData.msgSnippet: Greetings all =) This seems to refute the findings that John Kim came up with when he did the Mana Song vs. Mana Song/Heal Song twist test. If I can recall
ygData.messageBody:
Greetings all =)

This seems to refute the findings that John Kim came up with
when he did the Mana Song vs. Mana Song/Heal Song twist test.

If I can recall correctly, he found NO difference between singing
the mana song by itself versus singing the mana song with the heal
song mixed in.

Did I miss something ? GZ seems to imply that "If she aint
singing it, the finger wigglers arn't getting their crack"

Comments ?

Frashi (Vanitii?), 32nd Luted Bard
Seekers of Lore Officer, Tarew Marr http://www.loreseekers.com

----

> Message: 23
> Date: Fri, 03 Dec 1999 16:10:58 -0600
> From: "Snicker Furfoot, Esq." <snicker@...>
> Subject: From EQCasters (and added to the FAQ)

> Q: Why is there no Icon for the Bard Mana Song (Cassindra's Chorus of
> Clarity)?
>
> A: There are different types of Bard Songs. Most Bard Songs leave an
> icon on your character because the song has a duration - usually 5 to 15
> seconds. Each time the Bard sings the song she renews the duration -
> this means that a Bard who continues to sing the song can potentially
> keep the song effect going indefinitely.
>
> Some Bard songs do not have durations - you receive the effect when the
> Bard sings it, but will not get another "dose" until she sings it again.
> Cassindra's Chorus of Clarity (the mana song) is one of these songs - it
> does not have an actual duration, so you don't get an icon on your
> screen.
